name: successor
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 someone or something that comes after another person or thing: The university is seeking a successor to its vice chancellor, who retires this spring. This range of computers is very fast, but their successors will be even faster.
More examplesFewer examplesTraditionally, the president designates his or her successor.It remains to be seen whom the chairman will anoint as his successor.The hunt is on for a successor to Sir James Gordon.His name was mooted as a possible successor.The former leader now has to watch his successor unpicking much of what he strived so hard to achieve.
